titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: A brilliant but very hot day. I wrote letters in the garden, and read
volume all the morning. In the afternoon my nephew
arrived: he is spending a fortnight's leave from the front. After tea Ella and I took him for a walk along the sands as far as Minnis Bay, and came back along the cliffs.
